adjective.description: Formed or consisting of fragments of pre-existing rock produced by processes occurring on the earth's surface, such as erosion or weathering; (also) designating the structure of a rock formed in this way. Contrasted with autoclastic, "cataclastic", "pyroclastic".

origin: Late 19th century. From epi- + clastic. Compare earlier pyroclastic, and also cataclastic.
